TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit VisualStyleElement/Page/Down extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides objects for each state of a down indicator in an up-down or spin box control. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each property of the VisualStyleElement.Page.Down class gets a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> for the different state of a down indicator in an up-down or spin box control.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.Page.Down.Normal%2A> property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElement_Page_Down1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#37](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.v_34_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#37](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.v_34_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents the disabled state of the down indicator in an up-down or spin box control.
Docs.value: A that represents a down indicator of an up-down or spin box control in the disabled state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Disabled property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Disabled property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElement_Page_Down4` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#40](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.windows.forms.v_44_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#40](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.windows.forms.v_44_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents a down indicator of an up-down or spin box control in the hot state.
Docs.value: A that represents the down indicator of an up-down or spin box in the hot state.

remarks.format:

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents the down indicator of an up-down or spin box control in the normal state.
Docs.value: A that represents a down indicator up an up-down or spin box control in the normal state.

remarks.format:

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents the down indicator of an up-down or spin box in the pressed state.
Docs.value: A that represents a down indicator of an up-down or spin box in the pressed state.

remarks.format:
